title: Tipping Guide for House Cleaners & Cleaning Services

steps.title: You don't have to tip house cleaners unless you want to show appreciation.
steps.content: You don't have to tip house cleaners unless you want to show appreciation. House cleaning is different from other heavy tipping industries like food service, where the waitstaff make most of their salary from tips. You're only expected to tip when the house cleaner performs above and beyond your expectations or tackles a particularly tough mess. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tip cleaners from services or agencies 15%-20%.
steps.content: Tip cleaners from services or agencies 15%-20%. When you hire a cleaning service or agency, the cleaner who comes to your house receives only a percentage of the total bill. Adding a 15%-20% tip – which is the going rate for tips in the United States – helps increase their takeaway from the job and make it more worth their while. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tip 20% for infrequent or one-time services.
steps.content: Tip 20% for infrequent or one-time services. When you hire these cleaners, they're performing a deeper clean than a regular housekeeper and doing a lot of work. If the job is well done, that's worthy of a token of your appreciation. Plus, it encourages them to keep you on as a customer! [3] X Research source

steps.title: Don't tip a self-employed house cleaner unless you want to.
steps.content: Don't tip a self-employed house cleaner unless you want to. House cleaners who own their own business set their own rates, meaning they include things like a living wage and extra money for their high-quality services in the bill. There's no need to add a tip on top of that unless you just want to do so. [4] X Research source

steps.title: For weekly or bi-weekly house cleaners, tip once a month or once a year.
steps.content: For weekly or bi-weekly house cleaners, tip once a month or once a year. Tips for frequent house cleanings add up fast and can be hard to keep track of. Make it easier on both of you and set up a specific time to tip, such as at the end of the month. You can also add up the tips you would have given them throughout the year and present it to them as a holiday bonus. [5] X Research source

steps.title: For one-time or bi-annual cleaning services, tip every time.
steps.content: For one-time or bi-annual cleaning services, tip every time. Not only is it affordable to tip so infrequently, but it's also appropriate to thank these services for doing a good job and encourage them to return in the future. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tip your house cleaner when they go above and beyond.
steps.content: Tip your house cleaner when they go above and beyond. If your house cleaner exceeds your expectations, does something extra, or goes out of their way for you, show your appreciation by tipping. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Give them a gift card to somewhere they like to go.
steps.content: Give them a gift card to somewhere they like to go. Some appropriate options include their favorite coffee shop or a local fast food or dine-in restaurant. It's a small but meaningful gift you can use to reward your regular cleaner for a job they did particularly well. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Cook or bake homemade treats.
steps.content: Cook or bake homemade treats. Cookies, cupcakes, and pies all make excellent (and delicious!) gifts. Just remember to ask your house cleaner if they have any food allergies or dietary preferences first. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Buy a gift basket and fill it with food or fun items.
steps.content: Buy a gift basket and fill it with food or fun items. For example, you can fill the basket with their favorite fruits and snacks, or with pampering items like a pair of fuzzy socks, a stress ball, and a palm massage tool . If you're not sure what they would like, buy a pre-made gift basket online from a place like Harry & David or The Gift Basket Store .

steps.title: Keep it simple with a signed "thank you" card.
steps.content: Keep it simple with a signed "thank you" card. Your house cleaner may not expect or want a tip or a gift, but that doesn't mean you can't express how much you appreciate them. A simple card with a polite and grateful note inside, handwritten and signed by you, will go a long way to making them feel special.
